cab.content: From Viceroi/, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,6th December 1919.(Repeated British Military Attache, Tehran, under No. 78790.)(Received 8th.)16397. 6th December. Continuation of our 16152 of 1st December. Mailesontelegraphs following, dated 4th December: " Bokhara is to be dealt with, not necessarily in drastic fashion, as Bolshevics areanxious not to alienate Mahometans. But Bokhara must (a) surrender all whitefugitives now sheltering there; (6) give ample supplies of food ; (c) surrender cashin exchange for Bolshevic's paper, as Bolshevics can only carry on their plans inAfghanistan and Persia by means of cash, their paper being so depreciated."
